thread.title: Cutting the cord on cable and saving a thousand bucks a year
thread.title_full: Cutting the cord on cable and saving a thousand bucks a year

author: Doreen Christensen
title: Cutting the cord on cable and saving a thousand bucks a year
text:
Click here for the deal. The coupon expires Sunday, Oct. 18. 
Like Doreen's Deals on Facebook ; follow... 
Save $10 on a $30 purchase at Romano's Macaroni Grill with a coupon. 
Print the coupon or show it on your smartphone to save on any food purchases at participating locations; alcohol is not included. 
Click here for the deal. The coupon expires Sunday, Oct. 18. 
Like Doreen's Deals on Facebook ; follow... (Doreen Christensen) 
After a few annoying automated questions (NO! I do not want to order that fight on Pay-Per-View) and two accidental hang-ups, I got a helpful woman who started a game of how-low-can-we-go to-keep-your-business. 
I explained we were no longer willing to pay that much for cable. 
Right off the bat, the rep knocked off $20 a month for basic digital service with a "special promo." After I complained about paying $12 a month for digital adapters, which is how Comcast delivers service (why should I pay for that?), she gave me a one-time $70 credit. 
Within 15 minutes, she slashed $450 so I would only pay closer to $700 a year for service. 
Call back next month, she said, and the company will lower the monthly bill another 10 bucks. Cha-ching: Another potential $120 in annual savings. 
I was retained as a customer.
